page.title: 15ECOLOGY AT HARDWICK
page.content: The fact that much of the area around Hardwick Hall is owned by the National Trust means that there are many designated{conservation sites}and schemes. The{weather and climate is typical for this part of north-east Derbyshire.{Rain}is the predominant element, with occasional heavy{snows in winter. The vast parkland and fields hosts a variety of{wildlife, plants and trees. Within the Hardwick estate are many {footpaths,}having beautifully scenic surroundings both in the wooded hillside and by the lake. Since the population is small and {industrialisation}is notable by its absence, the main source of{pollution in the area emanates from the exhausts of the heavy motorway{traffic.
